titleproper.value:
Guide to the Marilyn Symmes Collection of Art Exhibition Ephemera
                    <lb/>1973-2016 (bulk 1990s-2016)
                    <lb/>
                    <num>PR 352</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Alison Barr and Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-05-01T16:15-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Marilyn Symmes collection of art exhibition ephemera

extent.value: in 19 document boxes, one artifact box, and four oversize folders

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection includes about 2,500 art gallery and museum announcements, posters, brochures, checklists, and other documents obtained by prints and drawings curator Marilyn F. Symmes, mostly from the 1990s-2016. Most of the material relates to modern and contemporary one-artist exhibitions, though two-artist and group exhibitions, including those with themed titles, are also represented. Most of the collection includes materials from New York City art galleries and museums, though institutions elsewhere in the United States and, to a lesser extent, in other countries are also represented.

p.value: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.
Credit line: Gift of Marilyn F. Symmes
<emph render="italic">(The above note was based primarily on a biographical note provided by Marilyn Symmes to N-YHS curator Marilyn Kushner.)</emph>

Most of the collection includes materials from New York City art galleries and museums, though institutions elsewhere in the United States and, to a lesser extent, in other countries are also represented. Among the many galleries represented in the collection are: Alexandre, DC Moore, David Findlay Jr., Deitch Projects, Gemini G.E.L., Grey Art Gallery at N.Y.U., Hirschl & Adler, Gagosian, June Kelly, Mary Boone, Mary Ryan, Matthew Marks, Michael Werner, Marian Goodman, Marlborough, Michael Rosenfeld, Pace, Pace/Wildenstein, Peter Freeman, Sperone Westwater, Sonnabend, Susan Teller, UBU, and David Zwirner. Museums include, among others, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), Whitney, Guggenheim, New Museum, Noguchi, Brooklyn, MassMOCA, Philadelphia, Cooper-Hewitt, Yale, and Zimmerli at Rutgers.

subject.value: Art galleries, Commercial -- New York (State) -- New York
Arts publicity -- New York (State) -- New York

dsc.value:
Series I. Single Artist Exhibitions 12.96 Linear feet 1973-2016 (bulk 1990s-2016) Scope and Contents Note

The series includes announcements, guides, brochures, checklists, artwork images, booklet catalogues, and posters from galleries, dealers and museums related to exhibitions centered on the work of one particular artist. The term “catalogue” is used loosely here and refers to a broad range of textual forms intended to provide some level of substantive insight into the content of an exhibition. By the donor’s count, there are approximately 2,000 items in this series.

The container list identifies some, though certainly not all or even most, of the artists represented in a particular folder of documents. Generally, artists were noted if there were several documents related to them or if the documents, even if only one was present, included substantive textual information, such as a checklist, description of artistic purpose, gallery layout, or biographical information. While acknowledging the subjective nature of the effort, an attempt was made to document within the container list where one could find brochure or booklet-type catalogues or other such documents concerning particular exhibitions. Researchers will no doubt find other useful documents within the folders, particularly high quality brochures emphasizing select artwork images or creatively designed gallery mailings, but not all artists and documents could be itemized in this finding aid within the constraints of processing resources.

 Arrangement Note

The series is arranged alphabetically by artist surname, retaining the order as presented by the collector/donor.

Oversize items: The series includes many oversize items. Those that were originally folded and are only slightly oversize were typically left folded and boxed. Larger pieces were also left folded if it appeared that their design was such that the opening of the piece was integral to interpreting it or appreciating it as an object. Although the items are not especially fragile, care should be taken in unfolding and refolding them; please request assistance from the reference librarian as needed. Several oversize items that were more in the nature of posters were removed from the folders, flattened, and stored separately; all such items are noted individually at the end of the alphabetical container list under the label “oversize.”

 Aa-Al 1 1 1994-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material from artists, among others, Marina Abramovic, Robert Adams, Yuji Agematsu, and Eric Aho.

 Am-Ap 1 2 2004-2013 Scope and Contents note

Includes material from artists, among others, Laurie Anderson, Benny Andrews, William Anthony, and Stephen Antonakos. Also includes a reflection by Laurie Anderson on her exhibition The Waters Reglitterized (2005). Includes catalogue Stephen Antonakos: Five Decades of Drawing from the Art Gallery at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York and a CD Stephen Antonakos: In his Studio.

 Artschwager, Richard 1 3 2003-2014 Ar-Az 1 4 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, among others, Diane Arbus, Cory Arcangel, Siah Armajani, George Ault, and Milton Avery. Includes a Whitney catalogue Cory Arcangel: Pro Tools. Includes a selected chronology of Charles Arnoldi. Includes a folded, poster-sized invitation for Kutlug Ataman's Journey to the Moon (2009). Includes a list of works in Milton Avery's exhibition Milton Avery: Onrushing Waves.

 Avadenka, Lynne 1 5 2002-2013 Scope and Contents note

Includes exhibition invitations, book release postcards, and New Year's cards signed by artist.

 Avedon, Richard 1 6 2003-2016 Ba-Ban 1 7 2002-2015 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Francis Bacon, Trisha Baga, John Baldessari, and Balthus.

 Bar 2 1 1996-2016 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Will Barnet, Hannelore Baron, and Jennifer Bartlett. Includes an invitation to Will Barnet's Gala Dinner to celebrate his 94th birthday and an invitation to celebrate Will Barnet at 100. Includes an invitation and press release for Jeannette Montgomery Barron on her portrait photograph exhibition. Includes a Jennifer Bartlett's postcard invitation with prices written on the back.

 Baselitz, Georg 2 2 1999-2015 Scope and Contents Note

Includes a brochure from the ESSL Collection with a short biography of the artist.

 Bas-Ben 2 3 1993-2016 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Leonard Baskin, Jean-Michel Basquiat, David Bates, Lothar Baumgarten, Romare Bearden, and Sadie Benning. Includes also a catalogue from The Whitney on Sadie Benning's exhibition Play Pause.

 Ber-Bl 2 4 1999-2016 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Joseph Beuys, Brett Bigbee, Oscar Bluemner, and Erwin Blumenfeld.

 Boc-Boz 2 5 1991-2015 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Mel Bochner, Christian Boltanski, Lee Bontecou, Fernando Botero, Louise Bourgeois, and Dusty Boynton. Includes the Yale University Art Gallery catalogue and family guide for Mel Bochner: Thought Made Visible.

 Bra-Bro 2? 6? 1993-2016 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Victor Brauner, Robert Broner, Marcel Broodthaers, Peter Brooke, Moe Brooker, James Brooks, Roger Brown, and Byron Browne. Includes also a Findlay Galleries catalogue, Peter Brooke: The Imagined and The Real.

 Brown, Cecily 3 1 2005-2014 Bu-By 3 2 1995-2016 Scope and Contents Note

Includes material from artists, among others, Charles Burchfield, Rudy Burckhardt, Chris Burden, and James Lee Byars.

 Ca-Cav 3 3 1993-2015 Scope and Contents note

Material from artists, including, among others, Paul Cadmus, John Cage, Alexander Calder, Sophie Calle, Cornell Capa, Anthony Caro, Mary Cassatt, James Castle, and Maurizio Cattelan. Also includes a 2004 Edmond Casarella brochure from the Susan Teller Gallery with a price list.

 Ce-Clo 3 4 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Material from artists, including, among others, Marc Chagall, John Chamberlain, Dale Chihuly, Francesco Clemente, and Chuck Close.

 Co-Coy 3 5 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Sue Coe, Dan Colen, James Coleman, James Cornell, Luc Courchesne, and Petah Coyne. Includes prospectus for The Ballad of Lemon and Crow by Glenn Todd, illustrated by Bruce Connor and anonymous artists.

 Cr-Cy 3 6 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Gregory Crewdson, John Cross, Merce Cunningham, and John Currin. Also includes a 1999 Queens College Art Center exhibition catalogue for John Crawford Sculpture, a 1995 Laurence Miller Gallery catalogue for Ralston Crawford Abstracting the Vernacular, and a 2003 Des Moines Art Center exhibition catalogue for John Currin Works on Paper.

 Da-DeK 4 1 1996-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Hanne Darboven, James Daugherty, Enrico David, Bruce Davidson, and Edgar Degas. Also includes a 2005 Boston Athenaeum exhibition catalogue for Power Line: The Art of Leo Dee.

 De Kooning, Willem and Elaine 4 2 1994-2013 Scope and Contents note

Includes a brochure from Washburn for 1994 exhibition Elaine de Kooning: Artists and Writers; other documents relate to Willem only. Includes a 1996 Whitney Museum brochure "Collection in Context: Willem de Kooning's Door Cycle" and a 2006 Matthew Marks Gallery checklist for Willem's exhibition Sketchbook.

 Del-Die 4 3 1996-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, thomas Demand, Walter De Maria, Claudia DeMonte, Philip-Lorca diCorcia, and Richard Diebenkorn. Also includes a Whitney Museum 1996 exhibition catalogue for Jane Dickson Paradise Alley.

 Dij-Doi 4 4 2003-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Jim Dine, Mark Dion installation The Octagon Room and Lois Dodd.

 Don-Dy 4 5 2003-2015 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Tara Donovan, Arthur Dove, David Driskell, Jean Dubuffet, and Carroll Dunham.

 Eb-Ei 4 6 1993-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Melvin Edwards and William Eggleston.

 El-Ev 5 1 2001-2014 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Olafur Eliasson and Lalla Essaydi.

 Fa-Fin 5 2 1999-2016 Scope and Contents note

Materials from artists, including, among others, Shepard Fairey, Zeng Fanzhi, Tony Feher, Teresita Fernandez. Also includes a David Findlay Jr. Gallery 2012 catalogue for John Ferren Works from the 1950s-1960s.

 Fis-Fox 5 3 1991-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Urs Fischer and Dan Flavin. Also includes a 2001 Durham Press catalogue Roland Fischer: Facades on Paper and a 2014 David Findlay Jr. Gallery checklist for Gordon Onslow Ford Space Elements.

 Fra-Fre 5 4 1973-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Robert Frank, Helen Frankenthaler, Norbert Freese, and Jane Freilicher.

 Fri-Fus 5 5 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Lee Friedlander, Yang Fudong, and Buckminster Fuller. Also includes a Marian Goodman Gallery 2012 brochure with interview extracts with Yang Fudong.

 Ga-Gh 5 6 1995-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Ellen Gallagher, Frank Gehry, and Juan Genoves. Also includes a Betty Cuningham Gallery 2006 catalogue for Charles Garabedian.

 Gia-Gol 5 7 1992-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Alberto Giacometti, Gilbert & George, Allen Ginsberg, Alexander Girard, and Andy Goldsworthy.

 Gon-Gra 6 1 1994-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, chris Gonyea, Brenda Goodman, Douglas Gordon, Arshile Gorky, Dan Graham, and Paul Graham.

 Gre-Gro 6 2 1993-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Red Grooms and Mark Grotjahn. Also includes a David Findlay Jr. Gallery 2013 catalogue for John Grillo: Works from the 1940s, 1950s, and 1960s.

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Andreas Gursky and Philip Guston. Also includes a 2002 announcement for a publication of Sandrine Guerin's Folio 1 with photographs of the four etchings to be included in the folio. Includes a 1997 walking tour guide "The Old World Builds New York: Guastavino Construction in Manhattan, 1886-1954," produced by the Avery Library at Columbia University

 Haa-Han 6 4 1999-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials from artists, including, among others, Zaha Hadid, Richard Hamilton, and Stephen Hannock. Also includes opening invitations and several exhibition catalogues /checklists for Jane Hammond.

 Har-Hay 6 5 1993-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material from artists, including, among others, Keith Haring, Marsden Hartley, Joseph Havel, and Tim Hawkinson. Also includes Museum of Modern Art 2003 exhibition catalogue for Here is Elsewhere, Mona Hatoum's contribution to MoMA's Artist's Choice series.

 He-Hir 6 6 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials for artists, including, among others, Al Held, Jean Helion, Auguste Herbin, Eva Hesse, and Damien Hirst. Also includes a Dieu Donne Papermill 2005 exhibition catalogue for Arturo Herrera How to drown while looking at a piece of paper.

 Ho-Hol 7 1 2001-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artsists, including, among others, David Hockney, Howard Hodgkin, Candida Hofer, Marietta Hoferer, and Jenny Holzer. Also includes a fundraising solicitation for art Matters, Inc, with enclosed Jenny Holzer Truism Stamps.

 Hon-Hy 7 2 1994-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Roni Horn, Sabine Hornig, Thomas Houseago, Zhang Huan, and Pierre Huyghe.

 I 7 3 2003-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Jorg Immendorff and Robert Irwin.

 Ja-Je 7 4 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Matthew Day Jackson and Neil Jenney. Also includes the Pace Wildenstein 1995 exhibition catalogue for Alfred Jensen Where the Gods Reside: Paintings 1963-1968.

 Ji-Ju 7 5 1994-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Jasper Johns, Ynez Johnston, and Donald Judd. Also includes a Print Club 1994 exhibition catalogue for Lois M. Johnson Latitudes, 1984-1994, and a Francis M. Naumann 2005 exhibition catalogue for Don Joint Catawumpus.

 Ka 7 6 1994-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Ilya and Emilia Kabakov, Frida Kahlo, Anish Kapoor, Alex Katz. Also includes a Walker Art Center 2008 exhibition catalogue Frida Kahlo, a Museum of Modern Art 1995 exhibition brochure Kandinsky Compositions, and a Guggenheim 2015 exhibition checklist, On Kawara -- Silence.

 Ke 8 1 1994-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Mike Kelley, Ellsworth Kelly, William Kentridge. Also includes a Hirshhorn Museum 2001 exhibition catalogue William Kentridge, a Getty Museum 1994 exhibition catalogue Andre Kertesz: A Centennial Tribute, and a Dieu Donne 2008 interview with Jon Kessler.

 Kh-Kn 8 2 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Anselm Kiefer, William Klein, Gustav Klimt, and Franz Kline.

 Ko 8 3 1999-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Jeff Koons and Harmony Korine. Also includes a Galerie St. Etienne 2013 exhibition catalogue for Kathe Kollwitz The Complete Print Cycles, and a Grey Art Gallery (NYU) 2003 exhibition catalogue for Paul Kos Everything Matters/ A Retrospective.

 Kr-Kw 8 4 2001-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Lee Krasner, Walt Kuhn, Guillermo Kuitca, and Yayoi Kusama. Also includes a Barbara Mathes Gallery 2007 exhibition catalogue for Yayoi Kusama From Here to Infinity, and a Whitney Museum 2012 exhibition catalogue, Yayoi Kusama.

 La-Lep 8 5 1991-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Gaston Lachaise, Wolfgang Laib and Jacob Lawrence. Also includes a Sperone Westwater 2015 exhibition catalogue Helmut Lang, a Hirschl & Adler Modern 2005 exhibition catalogue for Nancy Lawton Drawings in Sterling Silver, an Archives of American Art 1991 exhibition catalogue for Blanche Lazzell: A Modernist Rediscovered, and a Dahn Gallery 1995 exhibition catalogue for Annette Lemieux: Works from 1987-1992.

 LeWitt, Sol 8 6 2004-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes, among other documents, the prospectus for Squarings, a book of poems by Seamus Heaney with drawings by LeWitt, a MassMoCA 2008 Gallery Guide for Sol LeWitt: A Wall Drawing Retrospective, and a PaceWildenstein 2009 booklet Sol LeWitt: Forms Derived from a Cube, Wall Drawing #420B.

 Ler-Liz 9 1 1994-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Sandra Lerner, Helen Levitt, Roy Lichtenstein, and Maya Lin. Also includes an invitation to a 2003 Edgar Levy show at Susan Teller Gallery with a price list for his works.

 Lo-Ly 9 2 1999-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Whitfield Lovell, Markus Lupertz, and Vera Lutter.

 Mab-Map 9 3 1996-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Heinz Mack, Loren Maclver, Robert Mangold, Sally Mann, and Robert Mapplethorpe. Also includes a Harwood Museum of Art 2012 exhibition catalogue for Bea Mandelman:The Social Realist Prints, and a David Findlay Jr Gallery 2013 exhibition catalogue for Beatrice Mandelman:Works from the 1950s-1960s.

 Mar-Maz 9 4 2005-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Brice Marden, Herman Maril, John Marin, and Agnes Martin. Also includes a Mary Ryan Gallery 2010 exhibition checklist for Michael Mazur Pond Edge and David Findlay Jr. Gallery 2015 exhibition catalogue for Emily Mason.

 Me-Mi 9 5 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Julie Mehretu, Mario Merz, Annette Messager, Joel Meyerowitz, Duane Michals, and Richard Misrach.

 Mo 10 1 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Paula Moderson-Becker, Frank Moore, Henry Moore, Malcolm Morley, and Marie-Louise Motesiczky.

 Mu 10 2 2006-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Edvard Munch, Vik Muniz, Oscar Munoz, Takashi Murakami, Catherine Murphy, and Elizabeth Murray.

 Mc 10 3 2006-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Paul McCarthy, Ryan McGinness, John McLaughlin, Laura McPhee, and Steve McQueen. Also includes a David Findlay Jr. Gallery 2013 exhibition catalogue for Robert McChesney.

 Na-Ne 10 4 1991-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials for artists, including, among others, Elie Nadelman, Nabil Nahas, Bruce Nauman, Alice Neel, Louise Nevelson, Henry Roderick Newman, nd Barnett Newman. Also includes a David Findlay Jr. Gallery 2006 exhibition catalogue for Robert Natkin.

 Ni-Noz 10 5 1994-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Nicholas Nixon, Paul Noble, Isamu Noguchi, and Thomas Nozkowski. Also includes a Salander-O'Reilly Galleries exhibition catalogue for Graham Nickson, a 2003 Isamu Noguchi Foundation exhibition catalogue Noguchi Contours, and a few other Noguchi Museum publications.

 O 10 6 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials for artists, including, among others, Albert Oehlen, Helio Oiticica, Claes Oldenburg, Yoko Ono, Gabriel Orozco, and Tom Otterness.

 Pa-Par 11 1 2000-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes materials for artists, including, among others, Nam June Paik, Sky Pape, Aaron Parazette, and Betty Parsons. Also includes a 2000 Guggenheim Guide to Guggenheim Museums, a Chesterwood 2014 exhibition catalogue for Albert Paley, a Lisa Sette Gallery 2014 exhibition catalogue for Luis Gonzalez Palma, a Whitney 2010 exhibition catalogue for Karthik Pandian, a FIT Art and Design Faculty 2011 exhibition catalogue for a Kingsley Parker installation Upriver, a W.M. Brady 2005 exhibition catalogue for Simon Parkes, and a Park Avenue Armory 2015 exhibition catalogue for Philippe Parreno.

 Pas-Pey 11 2 2002-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Jaanika Peerna, A.R. Penck, Gelah Penn, Irving Penn, Emilio Perez, Raymond Pettibon, and Elizabeth Peyton. Also includes a 2014 Gagosian Gallery exhibition catalogue for Giuseppe Penone, a Marian Goodman Gallery 2015 exhibition catalogue for Giuseppe Penone, and a Gagosian Gallery 2016 exhibition catalogue for Giuseppe Penone.

 Pf-Pow 11 3 2002-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Ellen Phelan, Richard Phillips, Sarah Plimpton, and Charlotte Posenenske. Also includes a Whitney 2016 exhibition catalogue for Laura Poitras, a MoMA 2014 exhibition catalogue for Sigmar Polke, a Washburn Gallery 2003 exhibition catalogue for Jackson Pollock, and a Childs Gallery 2010 exhibition catalogue for Anne Lyman Powers.

 Picasso 11 4 2003-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material related to Pablo Picasso exhibitions.

 Pr-Q 11 5 2003-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Debra Priestly, Richard Prince, and Martin Puryear. Also includes a MoMA 2007 exhibition catalogue for Martin Puryear.

 Ra 11 6 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Paul Rand, Karim Rashid, Robert Rauschenberg, and Man Ray.

 Re-Rich 12 1 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Ad Reinhardt, Sam Reveles, Terry Richardson, and Gerhard Richter. Also includes an excerpt written by Prudence Peiffer on Ad Reinhardt's Projected Non-Happenings, and a Bernard Goldberg Fine Arts Gallery 2006 exhibition catalogue for Winold Reiss.

 Rin-Ros 12 2 1981-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Dorothea Rockburne, James Rosenquist, Clifford Ross, Medardo Rosso, and Theodore Roszak.

 Rot-Ry 12 3 1993-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Dieter Roth, Susan Rothenberg, Barbara Roux, Michal Rovner, Sterling Ruby, Thomas Ruff, Christ Rupp, and Robert Ryman.

 Ruppersberg, Allen 20 1 2013 Scope and Contents Note

Includes a boxed scroll (and explanatory note) from Gemini G.E.L. that documents Ruppersberg's work Great Speckled Bird on exhibition at the gallery. The scroll is signed and dated by Ruppersberg. Access restriction: The object can be unrolled only with the assistance of the conservator; advance arrangements are required.

 Ruscha, Ed 12 4 1995-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artist, Ed Ruscha, including a Whitney Museum catalogue for Ed Ruscha's 2005 Venice Biennale installation for the U.S. Pavilion.

 Sa-Sal 12 5 1996-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Betye Saar and Tom Sachs. Also includes a Finnish Cultural Institute in New York 2002 exhibition catalogue for Eero Saarinen: Realizing American Utopia.

 Sam-Scha 12 6 1997-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Lucas Samaras, Fred Sandback, and Jenny Saville. Also includes a Kristen Frederickson Contemporary Art 2004 exhibition catalogue Miriam Schapiro: A Retrospective.

 Sche-Sha 13 1 1994-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Julian Schnabel, Thomas Schutte, Joel Shapiro, and Willoughby Sharp. Also includes a Guggenheim Museum Willoughby Sharp Memorial program from 2009; text of a poem Paradise: A Dear Sip (That's Sweetheart, not Bambi) for Willoughby Sharp & Pamela Seymour Smith Sharp, written by Verandah Porche, with Porche's notes regarding the poem (dated 12 October 2009); and a Susan Teller Gallery 2003 exhibition checklist for Bernarda Bryson Shahn: Seventy-five Years of Work on Paper: 1928-2003.

 Seltzer, Phyllis - Correspondence 13 2 1993-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes correspondence, including exhibition invitations and brochures, between Phyllis Seltzer and Marilyn Symmes regarding Seltzer's work and heat transfer process. Also includes a Butler Institute of American Art 2011 catalogue for Phyllis Seltzer: Scapes. Also includes a sheet of slides with images of works by Phyllis Seltzer and her assistant Zoya Trofimova (1993-2001).

 Seltzer, Phyllis - Prints 13 3 2011-2012 Scope and Contents note

Includes 14 original prints by Phyllis Seltzer, some undated.

 Serra, Richard 13 4 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artist Richard Serra.

 She-Sim 13 5 2004-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Fazal Sheikh (2016 exhibition newspaper in English, Arabic and Hebrew for Erasures, and a brochure for Desert Bloom, the "central work" of Erasures), Cindy Sherman, Yinka Shonibare, James Siena, Laurie Simmons, and Taryn Simon.

 Sin-Sny 13 6 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, David Smith and Joan Snyder. Also includes a Susan Teller Gallery 2004 exhibition listing for Mitchell Siporin and a Robert Miller Gallery 2009 program for Patti Smith: Veil, An Evening of Words and Song.

 Soa-Ste 13 7 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Alec Soth, Michael Spano, and Frank Stella. Also includes a Smith College Museum of Art 2014 exhibition guide for Anne Whiston Spirn: The Eye is a Door.

 Sti-Sz 14 1 1989-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Alfred Stieglitz, Rudolf Stingel, Thomas Struth, and Hiroshi Sugimoto. Also includes a Getty Museum 2005 exhibition catalogue brochure for Paul Strand: Three Roads Taken.

 Ta-Te 14 2 1992-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Philip Taaffe, Barbara Takenaga, Mark Tansey, and Antoni Tapies. Also includes a NYU Grey Art Gallery 2004 exhibition catalogue for Atsuko Tanaka: Electrifying Art and a Kent Gallery 2005 exhibition checklist for Dorothea Tanning: Insomnias.

 Th-To 14 3 1998-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Robert Therrien, Frank Thiel, Fred Tomaselli, Niele Toroni, and Helen Torr. Also includes a Tiffany 1999 catalogue Highlights from the Tiffany & Co. Archives, and D.C. Moore Gallery 1998 and 1999 exhibition catalogues for George Tooker.

 Tr-Ty 14 4 2000-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Diane Tuft, James Turrell, Richard Tuttle, Luc Tuymans, and Keith Tyson. Also includes a Doris C. Freedman Plaza (Central Park) 2015 exhibition catalogue for Tatiana Trouve: Desired Lines, a I-20 Gallery 2000 exhibition catalogue for Spencer Tunick: Reaction Zone, and a 2005 Whitney exhibition guide for The Art of Richard Tuttle.

 Twombly, Cy 14 5 1995-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artist Cy Twombly, including a MoMA 1995 exhibition guide for Cy Twombly: A Retrospective.

 U 14 6 1993-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Lee Ufan and Tom Uttech. Also includes a prospectus for "A Day in the Bleachers" by Arnold Hano and illustrated by Mark Ulriksen.

 V 14 7 1994-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Manolo Valdes, James Valerio, Sara VanDerBeek, Francesco Vezzoli, and Bill Viola. Also includes a Whitney Museum 2010 exhibition guide for Sara VanDerBeek, a Museum of Contemporary Art, Cleveland, 2014 interview with Sara VanDerBeek, a Gagosian Gallery, Beverly Hills, and a Guggenheim Museum 2002 exhibition guide for Bill Viola: Going Forth by Day.

 Wa 15 1 1993-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Edmund De Waal, John Walker, Richard Walker, Darren Waterston, and Carleton E. Watkins. Also includes a Kraushaar Gallery 2005 exhibition pamphlet Lee Walton: Baseball Drawings, a Philadelphia Museum of Art exhibition guide Marcel Wanders: Daydreams, and a Massachusetts Museum of Contemporary Art 2014 exhibition pamphlet Darren Waterston: Uncertain Beauty.

 Warhol, Andy 15 2 1994-2014 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artist Andy Warhol, including a DIA Center for the Arts 1994 exhibition guide for Andy Warhol: The Last Supper Paintings, a prospectus for a limited edition portfolio of photographs of Andy Warhol taken by William John Kennedy in 1964, and a MoMA 2003 exhibition guide for Andy Warhol: Screen Tests.

 We-Wel 15 3 1993-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, William Wegman, Lawrence Weiner, Robert Weingarten, and Ai WeiWei. Also includes a Whitney Museum 2007 exhibition guide for Lawrence Weiner: As Far As The Eye Can See, a Kentler International Drawing Space 2006 exhibition pamphlet for Monika Weiss: Limen 2, and a Zimmerli Art Museum 2012 exhibition guide for Rachel Perry Welty: 24/7.

 Welliver, Neil 15 4 1995-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, Neil Welliver, including a Alexandre Gallery 2004 exhibition catalogue for Neil Welliver: Oil Studies.

 Wen-Whi 15 5 1992-2015 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Franz West, Minor White, and Rachel Whiteread. Also includes a Hall Art Foundation 2014 exhibition guide for Franz West: Les Pommes d'Adam, and a Clark Art Institute 1998 exhibition guide for Charles White: Progression of the American Negro.

 Wi 15 6 2001-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Charmion Von Wiegand, Kehinde Wiley, Christopher Williams, Philemona Williamson, Fred Wilson, and Jane Wilson. Also includes a Brooklyn Museum 2015 media preview for Kehinde Wiley: A New Republic, a MoMA 2014 exhibition guide for Christopher Williams: The Production Line of Happiness, and a Ubu Gallery 2006 publication for Stanislaw Ignacy Witkiewicz: Drawings from the 1930s, and a 2013 mailing from Michael Rosenfeld Gallery that included, with Wiegand. a large lapel pin for the exhibition American Abstraction.

 Wo-Wy 16 2 1997-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists, including, among others, Jonas Wood, Betty Woodman, Francesca Woodman, Christopher Wool, Alexi Worth, Frank Lloyd Wright, and Richard Wright. Also includes a New Museum of Contemporary Art 1998 exhibition guide for Sweet Oblivion: The Urban Landscape of Martin Wong, a Marian Goodman Gallery 2012 publication for Francesca Woodman: The Blueprints, and a National Building Museum 1997 exhibition guide for Frank Lloyd Wright: American Spirit Alive in Japan.

 X 16 3 2013-2016 Scope and Contents note

 Series II. Two Artists Exhibitions 0.21 Linear feet 1994, 2000-2016 Arrangement Note

The series is arranged alphabetically by the surname of the first artist used in the publicity material, retaining the order as presented by the collector/donor. One oversize item was flattened and stored separately, and is noted at the end of the container list.

 Scope and Contents Note

The series includes announcements, guides, brochures, checklists, artwork images, and posters from galleries, dealers and museums related to exhibitions centered on the work of two artists. There are approximately 55 documents in the series. The container list includes reference to all the exhibitions represented in the series, identifying them by artist surnames in the form “artist 1/artist 2.”

 A-C 16 6 1994, 2004-2016 Scope and Contents note

Includes material for artists Adamo/Castle, Albers/Albers, Albers/Judd, Allora/Calzadilla, Anderson/Low, Andrews/Israel, Apfelbaum/Giorno, Arbus/Nolan, Bailey/Hirst, Bearden/Lewis, Becher/Sander, Bertozzi/Casoni, Beuys/Le Va, Blume/Blume, Boetti/Bouabre, Bond/Simon, Byington/Nakadate, Calder/Prouve, Cardiff/Bures, Cattelan/Fontana, Chamberlain/Francis, and Chamberlain/Prouve.

 Series III. Multiple Artists Exhibitions 3.63 Linear feet 1992-2016 Arrangement Note

The series is arranged in alphabetical order, by institution name. There was no original order to the documents in this series so the arrangement was determined by the processing archivist. A few oversize items were flattened and stored separately, and they are noted at the end of the container list.

 Scope and Contents Note

The series includes announcements, guides, brochures, checklists, artwork images, and posters from galleries, dealers and museums related to exhibitions that included work by more than two artists. Generally, these exhibitions emphasized topics, genre, or other themes, rather than highlighting particular artists. Unlike the first two series, which identified artist names, the container list here identifies all the galleries or museums that presented exhibitions represented in the series. (Although the degree of overlap is not known, the institutions identified here are representative of those found in the first two series.) By the donor’s count, there are approximately 400 items in the series.
